title: Amazingly True Things #2
historical_context: This article reflects the controversial and provocative nature of the Cult of the Dead Cow (cDc) during the early 1990s, a time when hacker culture was beginning to intersect with broader social and political issues.
target_audience: Those interested in hacker culture, social commentary, and the intersection of technology with controversial ideologies.
short_summary: This article presents a satirical and disturbing interpretation of biblical texts to argue that events like the Holocaust and slavery are divinely ordained. It uses sarcasm to critique societal views on morality and justice.
summary: The article continues to delve into the topic of slavery, asserting that it is favored by God according to biblical texts. Ratte' argues that the institution of slavery is part of a divine plan, using scripture to support the claim that God's chosen people have the right to own slaves. This assertion is framed in a way that critiques modern views on human rights and morality, suggesting that the true message of the Bible has been lost in contemporary discourse. The tone remains sarcastic throughout, challenging readers to confront uncomfortable truths about historical interpretations of religious texts and their implications for modern society.
